title: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
description: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example are enabled and can be moved, but they don't have any effect. This behavior is misleading when opening a small image, such as an icon, because the scrollbars don't do anything.
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around, but they don't have any effect. This issue is observed regardless of the size of the image being opened.
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled and not allow any movement when they have no effect on the displayed image.
SR:
1. Launch the ImageAnalyzer example.
2. Open an image, such as an icon, in the application.
3. Observe that the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around, but they don't have any effect on the displayed image.
